p: The potential phytotoxicity of 246 against lettuce seedlings ( Lactuca sativa L.) was studied. Aqueous solutions of 246 ranging between 25 and 200 μg mL −1, were assayed for its effects on seed germination, root length, and shoot length of the lettuce. Compound 246 showed the most robust inhibitory effect on root growth. Compound 246 inhibited root growth by 50% at a concentration of 25 µg/mL. In addition, the highest concentration of 246 (200 µg/mL) strongly exerted an inhibitory effect on seed germination (90% inhibition) [ 81].
